pullRequest.title: Add explicit default constructors
pullRequest.bodyText:
Fixes new warnings in jdk16:
warning: [missing-explicit-ctor] class in exported package declares no explicit constructors, thereby exposing a default constructor to clients of module
Also fix javadoc of Stats class.

beforeCommit.message:
Add explicit default constructors

Fixes new warnings in jdk16:
  warning: [missing-explicit-ctor] class in exported package declares
  no explicit constructors, thereby exposing a default constructor to
  clients of module

Also fix javadoc of Stats class.

Signed-off-by: Keith W. Campbell <keithc@ca.ibm.com>

afterCommit.message:
Add explicit default constructors

Fixes new warnings in jdk16:
  warning: [missing-explicit-ctor] class in exported package declares
  no explicit constructors, thereby exposing a default constructor to
  clients of module

Also fix javadoc of Stats class.

Signed-off-by: Keith W. Campbell <keithc@ca.ibm.com>

nodes.bodyText: I only see static methods on this class.  Why provide a public constructor?  I'd be tempted to make the class final as well.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -32,6 +32,13 @@
  */
 public class Maths {
 
+	/**
+	 * Construct a new instance.
+	 */
+	public Maths() {

nodes.bodyText: Is there a reason to have a public constructor?  I also wonder about making this final
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -29,6 +29,13 @@
  */
 public class Version {
 
+	/**
+	 * Construct a new instance.
+	 */
+	public Version() {

nodes.bodyText: The variables are automatically initialized to zero without adding the bytecodes to explicitly do this. We've removed code like this from other places in the past to (slightly) reduce the code size and improve execution speed.

commit.message:
Add explicit default constructors

Fixes new warnings in jdk16:
  warning: [missing-explicit-ctor] class in exported package declares
  no explicit constructors, thereby exposing a default constructor to
  clients of module

In openj9.gpu for jdk16, make constructors private and classes final.

Also fix javadoc of Stats class.

Signed-off-by: Keith W. Campbell <keithc@ca.ibm.com>

nodes.bodyText: Same question about formatting as above.  I won't repeat it here but we should do the same with all copies of the pattern
